cards.flavor: "If the skies are our only refuge, I will see all of us take wing."
cards.name: Aven Mimeomancer
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a feather counter on target creature. If you do, that creature has base power and toughness 3/1 and has flying for as long as it has a feather counter on it.

cards.flavor: "We coat ourselves in steel every day. What is etherium but the next logical step?"
cards.name: Ethercaste Knight
cards.text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: "See, children of metal? Already your bodies are rejecting harm. Continue on our path, and perfection will be yours."

Flash

cards.flavor: "I craved enlightenment, and Crucius's etherium opened my eyes. I would share my sight with you, but first you must believe."
cards.name: Filigree Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Filigree Angel enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life for each artifact you control.

cards.flavor: "This violent wasteland is an indictment of its people. These cowards lack the will to oppose disorder."
cards.name: Meddling Mage
cards.text:
As Meddling Mage enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
The named card can't be cast.

cards.flavor:
"His body belongs to Bant now. His soul? I honestly don't know. I expect it belongs to the angels."
—Rafiq of the Many

cards.flavor: "The volcanic winds make a maze of the skies of Jund. If we mean to invade, we must first learn their invisible paths."
cards.name: Talon Trooper

cards.flavor: Creations made in madness may contain great power. The path to that power is as labyrinthine as the creator's mind.
cards.name: Unbender Tine

cards.flavor: It provides what every discerning mage requires—time to think.
cards.name: Wall of Denial

cards.flavor: This secret society of mages manipulates the beliefs and opinions of others.

cards.flavor: An Esper mage will leave a hole in your memory with surgical precision. A Grixis mage sees no reason to be so kind.

cards.text:
Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
Draw a card.

Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom in a random order.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: It was given life by the etherium of a hundred slain Esperites.

cards.flavor:
"The soul is only as eternal as I say it is."

cards.flavor: Words describing it fail. Pages relating it shrivel. Tales recounting it end.
cards.name: Nemesis of Reason
cards.text: Whenever Nemesis of Reason attacks, defending player puts the top ten cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Birth and death are both reversible."
—Nicol Bolas

cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Counter target creature spell.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The Maelstrom sent a wave of raw mana through the battlefield, carrying off the fighting and fallen alike.

cards.text: Return all creatures on the battlefield and all creature cards in graveyards to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor:
"I pray that I am never considered useless or old."
—Sharuum the Hegemon
cards.name: Time Sieve
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice five artifacts: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.flavor: For four nights following Ennor's death and the reclaiming of his etherium, its recipients were found slain, the etherium ripped from their bodies.
cards.name: Vedalken Ghoul
cards.text: Whenever Vedalken Ghoul becomes blocked, defending player loses 4 life.

cards.flavor: The blood of the demons quickened as their master rose over the battlefield. The blood of the angels also quickened: here was the chance to finally end the war started millennia ago.

cards.text: Breath of Malfegor deals 5 damage to each opponent.

"Stray not into sin, lest you face the doorman of an insatiable tomb."

cards.flavor: The last thought to go through their victim's mind is the one they tear out through the scalp.

cards.flavor: Even the balmgivers of Bant couldn't heal the incurables, but sharing their torment helped.

cards.flavor:
"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan
cards.name: Terminate
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: "May the earth rise up to meet you."

cards.flavor:
"In this new world, I have seen the once-devout rhoxes take up arms with the savages of Jund. I would be offended, but I see the wisdom in their choice."
—Gernan, Dawnray archer

"Some think its immunity to countermagic evolved because of the constant mage attacks on Naya. I think it just ate a bunch of wizards."

cards.flavor: "Here is the proof that what has been done may yet be undone. The hope we thought dead will be gloriously reborn."

cards.flavor: Those who worship the great gargantuans could hardly be expected to fight with a subtle weapon.

cards.flavor: Elspeth's squires do not seek advancement. For them, no knightly glory could surpass the glory of serving their champion.
cards.name: Dauntless Escort
cards.text: Sacrifice Dauntless Escort: Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A match for any army—even its own.
cards.name: Enlisted Wurm

cards.flavor:
"There is no glory in a death of age, as even the leotau know. As winter steals into their coats, they seek the deadliest lands, that they may die as they lived."
—Aarsil the Blessed
cards.name: Grizzled Leotau

cards.flavor: "I embrace all of Alara, Grixis as much as Bant. Let my former home call me traitor. I do this not for accolades, but because it is right."
cards.name: Knight of New Alara
cards.text: Each other multicolored creature you control gets +1/+1 for each of its colors.

cards.flavor:
"He is part of a new breed of guardian, one who embraces the best of both his world and ours."
—Mayael the Anima
cards.name: Knotvine Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Knotvine Paladin attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each untapped creature you control.

cards.flavor: Well suited are the nacatl to a coat of steel and forge-tempered claws.
cards.name: Leonin Armorguard
cards.text: When Leonin Armorguard enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: As pure mana flooded across the shards, it brought a sense of unity even to Jund's vicious food chain.

cards.flavor: "One sigil awarded for valor, the other awarded for surviving Hellkite's Pass."
cards.name: Sigil Captain

cards.flavor: As the elves learned the hymns of angels, the knights learned the roars of titans.

Enchant creature

"Do not mistake a behemoth's assistance for subservience."

cards.flavor:
"To join our ranks, one must be pure. To be pure, one must be blessed by etherium. To be blessed, one must forget oneself."
—Ethersworn prayer
cards.name: Identity Crisis
cards.text: Exile all cards from target player's hand and graveyard.

cards.name: Necromancer's Covenant
cards.text:
When Necromancer's Covenant enters the battlefield, exile all creature cards from target player's graveyard, then put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield for each card exiled this way.

cards.flavor: Sigils corrupted by outsiders do not lose their power, only their purity.
cards.name: Tainted Sigil
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tainted Sigil: You gain life equal to the total life lost by all players this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)

cards.flavor:
"I appreciate the artistry of the telemins, but the creatures of the other worlds provide a much more dramatic performance."
—Ennor, mentalist
cards.name: Vectis Dominator
cards.text: {T}: Tap target creature unless its controller pays 2 life.

cards.flavor:
"Jharic returned from Grixis changed, a haunted look in her eyes. She destroyed them with an unholy glee that made me shudder."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn
cards.name: Zealous Persecution
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and creatures your opponents control get -1/-1.

cards.flavor: "Let us flee to the deep jungle. Our city is no longer safe—and I suspect neither is the fallback retreat."
cards.name: Cloven Casting
cards.text: Whenever you cast a multicolored instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: They feared each other for their differences but were absolutely terrified at their similarities.
cards.name: Double Negative
cards.text: Counter up to two target spells.

cards.flavor: Giving a thing wings does not take away its fear of flight—or its fear of fire, for that matter.
cards.name: Magefire Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has flying.

cards.flavor: Their newfound wings shined elegantly and functioned partially.
cards.name: Skyclaw Thrash
cards.text: Whenever Skyclaw Thrash attacks, flip a coin. If you win the flip, Skyclaw Thrash gets +1/+1 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A king in Jund, a serf in Esper.
cards.name: Spellbound Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Spellbound Dragon attacks, draw a card, then discard a card. Spellbound Dragon gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: The forlorn cries of the dead combine to make its laugh.
cards.name: Lord of Extinction
cards.text: Lord of Extinction's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in all graveyards.

cards.flavor: During the collision of the shards, entire ways of life disappeared without a trace.
cards.name: Maelstrom Pulse
cards.text: Destroy target nonland permanent and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent.

cards.name: Marrow Chomper
cards.text:

cards.flavor:
"From the damned I make my garden."
—Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth

cards.text: Exile target creature card from a graveyard, then put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the exiled card's toughness.

cards.flavor: It reacted to Naya's overabundant food supply by growing additional mouths.
cards.name: Putrid Leech
cards.text: Pay 2 life: Putrid Leech gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: The unit of measurement used to chart a cerodon's growth is "persons consumed."

cards.flavor: When a battlefield falls silent, it's rarely due to a cease-fire.
cards.name: Fight to the Death
cards.text: Destroy all blocking creatures and all blocked creatures.

cards.flavor: "Their hopes dashed on our shields! Their victory slashed by our swords!"
cards.name: Glory of Warfare
cards.text:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.flavor: For hours afterward, all they could see was the grisly silhouette of their master, screaming.
cards.name: Intimidation Bolt
cards.text: Intimidation Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature. Other creatures can't attack this turn.

cards.flavor: The tips of her bolts are blunt, but her aim is deadly sharp.
cards.name: Stun Sniper
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Stun Sniper deals 1 damage to target creature. Tap that creature.

cards.flavor:
"The enlightenment I never found in etherium I have found traced in the coatl's scales."
—Ranalus, vedalken heretic
cards.name: Lorescale Coatl
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Lorescale Coatl.

cards.flavor: It crushes all underfoot, yet leaves no trace of its passage—no trampled debris, no flattened souls, not even a hoofprint.
cards.name: Nulltread Gargantuan
cards.text: When Nulltread Gargantuan enters the battlefield, put a creature you control on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: Godtrackers found new pantheons of beast-gods beyond Naya's borders.

cards.text: If you would draw a card, instead reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: "Etherium clouded my eyes, clogged my ears, desensitized my skin. Now that I can feel, I can begin to learn."
cards.name: Vedalken Heretic
cards.text: Whenever Vedalken Heretic deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: The nacatl called this new species "vetli," their word for poison arrows.

Flying

cards.flavor: The wilder the frontier, the greater the need for a controlling hand.

cards.text:

cards.flavor: An unbound page is a riddle, free of cover and of context, a favorite token of the hegemon.

At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• You gain 2 life.
• Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
• Each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: They are the masters of your mind.
cards.name: Sen Triplets
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target opponent. This turn, that player can't cast spells or activate abilities and plays with his or her hand revealed. You may play cards from that player's hand this turn.

cards.flavor: No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"
cards.name: Sphinx of the Steel Wind
cards.text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green

cards.flavor: Every disaster holds mystery, for lack of a sane witness.
cards.name: Drastic Revelation
cards.text: Discard your hand. Draw seven cards, then discard three cards at random.

cards.name: Grixis Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Grixis Sojourners or it dies, you may exile target card from a graveyard.
Cycling {2}{B} ({2}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: His name means "he who paints the earth red."
cards.name: Thraximundar
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Thraximundar attacks, defending player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever a player sacrifices a creature, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Thraximundar.

cards.name: Unscythe, Killer of Kings

cards.flavor:
"Look there—they carry that one upon a sedan chair. It must be their leader. Wait . . . Oh! Perhaps not."
—Kaeda, aven scout
cards.name: Dragon Appeasement
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you sacrifice a creature, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Jund Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Jund Sojourners or it dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {2}{R} ({2}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund
cards.text:
Flying, haste
When Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund enters the battlefield, gain control of all Dragons, then untap all Dragons.
Other Dragon creatures you control have haste.

cards.flavor: Alara's burning blood cannot be contained by mere earth and stone.
cards.name: Lavalanche
cards.text: Lavalanche deals X damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Death comes in the blink of an eye.
cards.name: Madrush Cyclops
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste.

cards.flavor:
"This is a new world and a new war. We need warriors who know chaos and how to combat it."
—Lisha of the Azure
cards.name: Gloryscale Viashino
cards.text: Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, Gloryscale Viashino gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mayael's Aria
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control if you control a creature with power 5 or greater. Then you gain 10 life if you control a creature with power 10 or greater. Then you win the game if you control a creature with power 20 or greater.

cards.flavor: The elves had entered a land like an open grave—an act of fortitude or folly?
cards.name: Naya Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Naya Sojourners or it dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: For every eye, an eye. For every tooth, a tooth. Griffins are nothing if not fair.
cards.name: Retaliator Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Retaliator Griffin.

cards.flavor: It strides through the whitecover, mists in which even gargantuans can hide.
cards.name: Uril, the Miststalker
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Uril, the Miststalker gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

cards.flavor: "We must spread Bant's light before we are shadowed over."
cards.name: Bant Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Bant Sojourners or it dies, you may put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Finest Hour
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, if it's the first combat phase of the turn, untap that creature. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.flavor: "We are born soldiers. The call to battle is a homecoming."
cards.name: Flurry of Wings
cards.text: Put X 1/1 white Bird Soldier creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield, where X is the number of attacking creatures.

cards.flavor: Wounded soldiers looked up, grateful for her appearance. But she passed over them, her eyes firmly on their foe.
cards.name: Jenara, Asura of War
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Jenara, Asura of War.

cards.flavor: Bant mages still call to the heavens for aid, but angels are not the only ones who answer.
cards.name: Wargate
cards.text: Search your library for a permanent card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Maelstrom Nexus
cards.text: The first spell you cast each turn has cascade. (When you cast your first spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom in a random order.)

cards.name: Arsenal Thresher
cards.text: As Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield, you may reveal any number of other artifact cards from your hand. Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each card revealed this way.

cards.flavor: Stormcallers came to appreciate the novelty of Jund's volcanic updrafts.
cards.name: Esper Stormblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Esper Stormblade gets +1/+1 and has flying.

cards.flavor:
"Etherium is limited. Innovation is not."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Thopter Foundry
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a nontoken artifact: Put a 1/1 blue Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Grixis Grimblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Grixis Grimblade gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)

cards.flavor:
"Too wary to charge, too prudent to serve. Not anymore."
—Sedris, the Traitor King
cards.name: Sewn-Eye Drake
cards.text: Flying, haste

cards.flavor: Nicol Bolas doesn't distinguish between servants and victims.
cards.name: Slave of Bolas
cards.text: Gain control of target creature. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: It waits with absolute stillness. One might think it a statue if it weren't occasionally seen chewing on its victims.
cards.name: Giant Ambush Beetle
cards.text:
Haste
When Giant Ambush Beetle enters the battlefield, you may have target creature block it this turn if able.

cards.flavor: The knights were halfway through their precombat rites before they realized the foul brute meant to start without them.
cards.name: Jund Hackblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Jund Hackblade gets +1/+1 and has haste.

cards.flavor:
"Sangrite is the dragon's beating heart. Little wonder, then, that so many fools' chests burst trying to contain it."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Sangrite Backlash
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-3.

cards.flavor:
"Looks like we're completely outnumbered."
"Lucky for us. I thought we'd be bored."
cards.name: Marisi's Twinclaws
cards.text: Double strike

cards.name: Naya Hushblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Naya Hushblade gets +1/+1 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Trace of Abundance
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.flavor: Soldiers who fought through Grixis learned to hit first, recite the prayer of Asha later.
cards.name: Bant Sureblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Bant Sureblade gets +1/+1 and has first strike.

cards.name: Crystallization
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, exile that creature.

cards.flavor: So many aven had died scouting the distant fronts that the knight-captains recruited Nayan falcons as couriers.
cards.name: Messenger Falcons
cards.text:
Flying
When Messenger Falcons enters the battlefield, draw a card.
